title: Eliminate a Variable
text: Elimintate the y's by multiplying the second equation by 5. $$6x-5y=-1$$ $$5\left(2x+y\right)=5\times13$$

title: Add the Equations to Eliminate One Variable
text: Add the x's, y's, and constants. y will be eliminated and then solve for x. $$16x=64$$ $$x=4$$

title: Substitute Solution into Original Equations
text: Substitute $$x=4$$ into the first equation, $$6x-5y=-1$$. Then solve for y. $$6x-5y=-1$$ $$6\times4-5y=-1$$ $$24-5y=-1$$ $$-5y=-25$$ $$y=5$$

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is (4,5).
